review_title: A company I would highly recommend
pros: FHN is a company I would highly recommend to just about anyone considering applying here. It’s a great company to work for and I can’t see myself ever working anywhere else.
cons: None that are worth mentioning out of context.

pros: Pay is ok, benefit package is the reason I stayed for as long as I did.
cons: It's a stressful job. Medical assistants are always the last to get recognized. Providers have no control of their own schedules. Operation supervisors (clinical side) and Management are not that great. People that move up are their own personal friends so the chain just continues when it comes to lack of knowledge instead of hiring people who know their stuff. Pay used to be great and competitive, not anymore. If you just want a job, apply at FHCN, they seem to just hire anyone now a days.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Hanford, CA
pros: You get your hours and good benefits.
cons: Don't treat you right. Hard workers don't get rewarded. Only worry about numbers

pros: Sign on and retention bonus
cons: If not meeting your quota of patients, forced to work extra. Supervisors are good however clinics are run but office managers and supervisors who tend to divide staff and breed a culture that is unpleasant.

pros: It's a job, with major headaches
cons: Patient care volume too high, management is clueless. Management does not want any input from providers...even though they are not providers. They don't manage, they simply try to bribe you with a bonus that has major strings attached.

review_title: Incredibly rewarding work for a largely underserved community
pros: I worked primarily with migrant farm workers during my time at Family Healthcare Network. It was an incredibly eye-opening experience and really made me recognize just how important accessible healthcare is, and it was also one of the most rewarding career experiences I’ve had to date.
cons: The hardest part about the job was dealing with the emotions that came with helping people who were so needy and so grateful. It wasn’t easy. What most people take for granted, they barely even expect. The disparity was shocking to me at first, and even once I got used to it, when I realized that I had become desensitized to it, there was a certain amount of guilt and shame that came with that.

pros: Simplified onboarding process. Some of the most kind employees.
cons: Management is clueless. Workload is at least double what it should be.

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Fresno, CA
pros: -Pay is good for the area. -Helping the underserved. -Plenty of overtime opportunities. -Opportunities for student loan repayment. -Opportunities to see a wide range of patient's and perform in office procedures.
cons: -All visits are scheduled at 15 minutes regardless of reason for visit. -Too many patients scheduled in a shift (36 patients in a 9 hour shift once you hit 2 years experience). -Scheduling guidelines are not followed. -Problems keeping MAs b/c company does not treat MAs as well as it should. This effects the ability for providers to do job efficiently. -High provider turnover. -The air quality and amount of homelessness in the area are atrocious.

pros: Plenty of opportunities to learn
cons: No problems, a little hectic at times but that’s given with any job

pros: Great staff and providers, good benefits
cons: The pay does not compare to other places, medical assistant with no experience get paid $19 -20 starting

job_title: Dental Patient Service Representative in Visalia, CA
pros: Works with you Hours Benefits Yearly evaluation
cons: Sent out often Call outs

pros: If you know what you’re doing, or even if you just pay attention during the training and the first few weeks, then the work is easy enough and for what you get paid you really can’t ask for better.
cons: I had a good run here and wish them nothing but the best. It was time for me to move on, so I did but I’m going to miss it because it was just easy money.

review_title: No Nonsense work Environment. Which was refreshing!
pros: Most of management really seemed to care about their employees and the patient's they serve.
cons: Non that i can think of. I wish i was still there.

review_title: Everything we do is for the patients
pros: The best part about working here is that everything we do is for the patients. This isn’t a business masquerading as a healthcare provider, it’s a healthcare provider that also happens to be a business and needs to put the bare minimum attention into bringing a profit, but NEVER at the expense of patient welfare.
cons: Not everyone wants to work for a healthcare company that actually cares about the people it serves.

pros: Yeah I’d recommend it to you if you’re thinking about giving it a shot. It’s not a bad place to work and you can definitely build a solid career on the foundation you’ll get working there.
cons: Some people make the best of things and some people just complain. I’m not a complainer.

pros: The management team here could quit and work as consultants for how to communicate within a healthcare organization, they were that good at maintaining communication across all departments.
cons: The job opportunities weren’t there for long-term career growth.

pros: Working for Family Healthcare Network was a good learning experience for me and I don’t see myself ever regretting a minute of the time I spent working there.
cons: I have zero regrets about working for this company.

job_title: COMMUNITY HEALTH REPRESENTATIVE in Fresno, CA
pros: The pay is insane. My starting salary just about blew me away (probably the main reason I ended up working here) and the increases I’ve received each year are more than generous. The work is hard and the hours are long, but we’re definitely paid well for it.
cons: Like I said, it’s hard work and you’re expected to really put in those hours.

review_title: Great place to build up your skills
pros: This is a great place to work to build up your skills and grow in your career.
cons: Not so great if you’re just looking for an easy paycheck.

pros: In short, the pros to working at HFN are: Two weeks paid vacation each year Better than average pay Management is open to feedback The patients are lovely Coworkers aren’t incompetent idiots
cons: The only con to working at HFN was: Management has a problem with over-managing most aspects of the work day

job_title: COMMUNITY HEALTH REPRESENTATIVE in Fresno, CA
pros: Incredible people Plenty of time off Competitive starting salary Excellent benefits Fun company events Clear and reasonable expectations
cons: Limited opportunities for real growth

review_title: Great opportunity to learn a wide variety of procedures
pros: Working for Family Healthcare Network provides a great opportunity to learn a wide variety of procedures as they get a wide variety of patients with a wide variety of health concerns.
cons: The hours in healthcare are long and brutal, especially if you have a newborn at home.

pros: I highly recommend FHN to anyone who’s thinking about working here. It’s great!
cons: None in my opinion, but I love it here.

pros: Good vacation time each year and good emphasis on work/life balance.
cons: Pay was just so so.

pros: Very fast-paced and challenging work environment.
cons: I was hoping to get promoted after two years, but it wasn’t possible.

review_title: Not a bad place to start out
job_title: Registered Dental Assistant in Fresno, CA
pros: Really not a bad place to start out and learn the ropes.
cons: Nothing. I learned everything I needed to know.

pros: *Great environment *Friendly people *Good leadership *Stupid good pay *Excellent healthcare (obviously)
cons: *Only two weeks vacation each year

pros: Everything has been good so far (pay, people, hours, patients)
cons: Nothing that I can think of

pros: Good pay nice coworkers that’s all
cons: They give you bad reviews not to give you a proper raise. They expect you to do multiple jobs for the sameness pay.

job_title: COMMUNITY HEALTH REPRESENTATIVE in Visalia, CA
pros: Good people to work with.
cons: Problems with changing systems often.

review_title: Your experience here has alot to do with your outlook.
job_title: Registered Dental Assistant in Visalia, CA
pros: Benefits ( Medical, dental and vision) Great coworkers and providers. 4 day work week but full time pay. Dental management is pretty fair in scheduling and allocating staff where needed.
cons: There is a staffing shortage as is everywhere else. You will feel overworked at times. But it's nothing that can't be handled. Again, it's what you make of it. This is a community health center so don't have the expectation foe things to be like a private office and you should be fine.

pros: Great coworkers, staff, most providers very friendly
cons: Micromanaged. Low pay. Not much incentives

review_title: Great place to start your caree
pros: Learn a lot and you normally do work outside the normal scope of your job title great for first time workers in a field
cons: Work load is unrelenting and the rules like dress code and communication are unrealistic

job_title: COMMUNITY HEALTH REPRESENTATIVE in Visalia, CA
pros: Great networking and skill building.
cons: Low pay for amount of work. Hostile work environment brought upon all levels of managment in different departments.

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Visalia, CA
pros:
- great base salary as new grad
- complete benefits package
- great malpractice coverage
- great support + resources
cons:
- scheduled with a patient load higher than contracted for
- patients were not scheduled correctly which negatively impacted clinic flow

job_title: Front Medical Office Assistant in Visalia, CA
pros: Competitive pay, no experience necessary.
cons: Not a 8-5 schedule. Works most of weekend

pros: Good environment, friendly, easy place,
cons: Hectic, rude patients, bad experience

review_title: Go pace of work, pay is okay, great benefits! Good starter job.
pros:
Great benefits. 
People make it a good place to work at. 
A lot of work to do. Never boring, but always busy.
cons:
Managers play favorites. 
Not the best review system as far as letting employees know what needs to be done to improve.

pros: Pay — that’s it. But you only get a raise when they see people are leaving.
cons: Leadership doesn’t care about you. I’m in a management and BELIEVE ME— Coming from NV to the directors of ops —we are told to see numbers and not staff. Motto is - “well maybe this job isn’t for you” every time a staff has issues. This way it makes it seem like the staff is incompetent and just complaining.  With the help of HR— things will go against you.

pros: Good for obtaining experience and for learning
cons: Not a good company to work for

pros: Good medical, dental and vision benefits. Great Training department that’s always willing to help.
cons: Will hire you for one site and make you work at any of their other sites all over the valley on a moments notice.

pros: Nice coworkers, keeps you busy enough, decent pay
cons: Usually can't really get more hours, management communication isn't always there but are somewhat accessible

pros: The benefits this office offers is great
cons: Having to travel wasn't great

review_title: High Job Role and Expectations, Horrible Pay
pros: Gain lots of experience, skills and knowledge.
cons: Your higher degree (Bachelors) means nothing when i comes to pay or program working in. Tied to one program but are always pulled to do other things not related to program. Stressful!

pros: Benefits dental and medical are okay
cons: Managers are rude for no reason

pros: Friendly and very easy to adapt to your job duties. Vacation and sick leave pay is good. Bonus pay is good because it arrives you to be better as a team. Bonuses are given out when the clinic reaches its goal of customer service servers that they conduct monthly. Awesome for a first time job to get experience. I actually stayed there for 7 years.
cons: Very late shifts and no stable schedule. Very competitive in everything. No room to grow within this company, if your good at something, they will keep you there and not let you expand your knowledge in other departments. Salary is unfair especially for the seniority. Yearly evaluation are very unfair, it seemed to me that the supervisors just guessed in what you had accomplished that year, instead of asking for feedback from other co-workers or providers. When requesting a time off, either vacation or sick...it was a challenge they always try their best to keep you there no matter what like "we are short staffed" in that case there are floats on other departments or clinics that can cover for a day or two. Management was unfair and would never stand for us as medical assistant, especially Supervisors. Sometimes there only one medical assistant working with a provider seeing about 35 pt a day including administering injections, physicals, paps, and procedures. This creates overtime and overtime is a no no for them, they tell us we should have asked for help, and when we do they ignore us sometimes, not all the time but most of the time.

pros: Good benefits. Full time work.
cons: Covid messed with so many jobs...but other than that its a good place to work

pros: good experience, good pay, loan repayment
cons: overworked, understaffed, location, poor communication with staff

pros: Great benefits and learning opportunity
cons: It’s very busy and fast paced

pros: Its nice to help people
cons: Unorganized at times and a lot of turnover

job_title: Physician Assistant, PA-C in Porterville, CA
pros: Perfect exposure for new graduates
cons: Heavy work load and fast paced

pros: You can cross train there
cons: Supervisors don’t care about you

job_title: Risk Management Analyst in Visalia, CA
pros: Not started not sure how it will go
cons: Unaware of cons because I have. OT shatted

review_title: Good place to work until you open your eyes
pros: It's easy enough to get your foot in the door here to gain experience, A majority of staff are pleasant to work with.
cons: Management is horrible. They are always looking for what is being done wrong instead of what is being done right. There is promise of things getting better,but that never happens.  There is no acknowledgment to staff that go above and beyond for the patients every day, there is no boost to moral.  Wages are too low for what is expected. Managers bully employees beneath them.

pros: Great pay and great benefits.... not all sites are the same...easy way to grab some experience under your belt
cons: With the great perks comes all the extra, out of your job description demands...communication between all positions(navigation,supervisors,managers,other assistants) is horrible. No single person takes ownership of what’s going on, nobody listens to your concerns as an employee..you will be given a “why” behind everything you question..and brushed away and you are replaceable...no matter how great you are. This is a revolving door of providers and a good dr is impossible to find because they all got smart and left.

review_title: Decent pay, poor management, and sweat shop quotas
job_title: Certified Professional Coder in Visalia, CA
pros: Benefit package, and moste fellow employees.
cons: Management passes their personal duties to staff, poor leadership, that projects poor moral among coders, and billing.  unrealistic quotas, with no regard to errors "Just put it out and redo later".  Why would a company want to pay twice for the same work?  No training to help improve or maintain credentials of staff

pros: Many great employees devoted to the company’s mission. Pay is good. Helping patients from community is rewarding and joyful.
cons: First priority are the numbers. Lack of concern for people comes from lack of leadership. Employees are overworked and under appreciated. Ridiculous micromanaging with an attitude of figure it out. Undertrained and understaffed and discriminating hiring practices.

review_title: A good place to work, with an admirable mission
pros: Meduim-sized Community Health Center organization with around twenty clinics. Good, friendly staff with lots of opportunity to advance from within.
cons: Management can be unfocused and can lean too heavily on a disciplinarian approach rather than positive motivation. Lower than average pay rates and petty HR regulations lead to frequent turnover.

review_title: Amazing Opportunity as a New Grad
pros: Great compensation for a new grad health professional if you're looking to get your loan repayment, license and CE reimbursements, your own work laptop to take home, paid holidays, flexibility. After moving away to the Bay Area, I seriously miss working at FHCN with their competitive pay in an area of lower cost of living
cons: Had to work at least one late shift until 9pm and 1 Saturday a month, which is not that bad

pros: The cost of living is affordable and there's little traffic in Tulare and Kings County.  The co-workers and management are generally responsive and work with you.  There are frequent bbqs and pot-lucks at each clinic.
cons: Be prepared to do tons of paper-work especially on behalf of medi-cal insurance and Health Quality Measures.   You will see some complex conditions but you have MD's, DO's, and psychologists to help you out in the Network

pros: Easy to get in to as long as you pass assessment tests.
cons: Very very low salary and are only competitive if exact job title was previously held even if you have way more experience. Supervisor come and go, staff are very over worked. Other employees will tell you that is not their job when asking for help and to send it all to the corporate office. Very stressful workplace, not by employees only by the amount of workload given verse very little pay.

review_title: Satisfied about working for a non-for-profit with a very clear mission.
pros: In my experience the best two things about FHCN, were professional growth and the satisfaction of pursuing a noble mission: serve the underserved.
cons: I would say that being one of the most successful Federally Qualified Health Center across the country, it could be a little bit stressful sometimes, but something that can be handled.

pros: I learned a lot of hospital and clinical billing. previous experience was SNF and Home Health and Hospice.
cons: Personal reasons, I felt there were several employees, including me that were treated unfairly. Several of us had went to HR about the dept manager and nothing has been done about anything, still. The stress load is very heavy and the manager was foul mouthed and very hateful most times.

pros: We are able to provide meaningful contributions to our community. Excellent pay and benefits. Plenty of room for advancement. Constantly learn new skills. Coworkers become a second family.
cons: Scheduling changes and errors are an ongoing issue. Difficult to get time off approved. Lack of good communication between supervisors and staff.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Visalia, CA
pros: Will help you get experience to get hired elsewhere, a good "foot in the door."
cons: There are too many to list, nepotism, favoritism, terrible company. Will make you feel scummy for even working here and being associated with this trashbag company.

pros: Good benefits, PTO, Work with many dentists which learning new techniques is a plus.
cons: Dental needs a back office manager to deal with back office only.
